In keeping with the requirements outlined in OSHA's 29 CFR 1910.119 (PSM) and EPA's 40 CFR
68, Thatcher Company has developed and established policies and procedures designed to identify potential hazards and to minimize the possibility of significant accidental discharges and release of hazardous materials. Details are referenced in SOP EHS-15.

Generally, Thatcher Company components for the accidental release prevention program includes a commitment to process safety, an understanding of hazards and risk, management of risk and learning from experience as well as compliance with regulatory requirements. The plant has a Process Safety Management (PSM) system for the covered processes as defined by OSHA. The ammonia program documentation include the following PSM elements: process safety information; process hazard analysis; operating procedures; training; mechanical integrity; management of change; pre-startup safety review; compliance audits; incident investigations; employee participation; hot work permit; contractor management; and emergency planning and response. Throughout the plant, a hierarchy of controls has been implemented including hazard elimination, substitution, engineering controls, toxic gas
sensors, administrative controls and personal protective equipment to minimize or eliminate
exposure to hazards. Infrastructure security improvements at designated areas in the plant have
been implemented that provide layers of protection against deliberate man-made incidents in
accordance with applicable elements of U.S. Department of Homeland Security's CFATS Risk
Based Performance Standards.

In the past five years, Thatcher Company has had no accidental releases. 

TCSLC has developed an Emergency Response Plan (SOP EHS-13). The plan outlines actions and procedures to be utilized in the case of emergency action involving fires and the releases of, or substantial threats of releases of hazardous substances. Thatcher Company of Montana is a leader in the water purification chemical industry manufactures and distributes environmental chemicals for the municipal, agricultural, mining, and industrial markets. The TCMT facility is a repackager, manufacturer and distributor of various industrial chemicals. Major markets include drinking water treatment, wastewater treatment, industrial applications, agriculture, and food processing.  Ammonia (including mixtures and byproducts) is distributed to the water treatment, wastewater treatment,
agriculture and industrial markets. Thatcher Group states in its EHS Charter that the Environmental, Health, Safety, and Security Mission is to achieve a manufacturing environment that we are proud of by continuously improving our ability to provide our customers with quality products and services that meet their needs while operating with the highest standards of safety and environmental compliance.

To operate with the highest standards of safety and environmental compliance, our  commitment to EHS must include: compliance with work instructions and procedures; clear expectations; a constant focus on prevention; active participation; awareness on and off the job; strong leadership; and personal responsibility. Further, a commitment to EHS must include personal accountability for their EHS performance and for the EHS performance of those they manage or supervise.

In addition to EPA's RMP rule, the Thatcher Company complies with State and Federal OSHA's
Process Safety Management, EPA's State and Federal Hazardous Waste Generator, DHS's
Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standard and DOT's Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety
Administration regulatory requirements. In this RMP submission, there is one Worst-case toxic
release scenario and one Alternative Case toxic release scenarios evaluated for ammonia.
